page.title: 09EDUCATION-WADEBRIDGE SCHOOLS
page.content: There are four schools in Wadebridge three of which are maintained by the Cornwall Education Committee and one is a private nursery school. There is a{Junior Girls and Infants School}on the east side of the river which has{ {240 pupils}consisting of infants aged 4+ to 7 and girls from 7 to 11. The{ {Junior Boys School}on the west side of the river has{112 boys}aged 7 to 11.Wadebridge is unique in Cornwall as it has the only{single sex schools}in the county. Both schools are over 100 years old. A new{Mixed Junior and {Infants School}is planned but there is difficulty in finding a suitable site. The{Comprehensive School}was built in the sixties and has{1070 pupils}on roll.Its pupils come from both{ {Wadebridge Junior Schools, Padstow, St {Merryn, St Minver, St Issey, St Kew {and St mabyn.}
